Detailed Description

The Tone Interface.

VoIP Session - Tone

The tone table locates in "/linux_kernel/rtk_voip/voip_dsp/dsp_r0/dspparam.c". Developer can access the table and modify the setting of tones.
The Table 5 shows the different tones in tone table.

Table 5. Tone table

Number Tone Name
1 Dial tone
2 Stutter-dial tone
3 Message waiting tone
4 Confirmation tone
5 Ring-back tone
6 Busy tone
7 Congestion tone
8 Roh tone
9 Double ringback tone
10 Sit-no circuit tone
11 Site-intercept tone
12 Sit-vacant tone
13 Sit-reorder tone
14 Calling cord with event tone
15 Calling card tone
16 Call waiting #1 tone
17 Call waiting #2 tone
18 Call waiting #4 tone
19 Call waiting #4 tone
20 Ingress ringback tone
The tone is various in different countries. The VoIP SDK pre-defined the tones using in these countries.
These countries include USA, UK, Australia, Hong Kong, Japan, Sweden, Germany, France, Taiwan, Belgium, Finland, Italy and China.
Beside this users can set their custom tone they like.

Function Documentation

int32 rtk_SetAnswerToneDet ( uint32  chid,
uint32  config,
int32  threshold 
)

Set the answer tone detection.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
configThe answer tone detection mode, 0:disable 1:enable
Bit0: CNG_TDM
Bit1: ANS_TDM
Bit2: ANSAM_TDM
Bit3: ANSBAR_TDM
Bit4: ANSAMBAR_TDM
Bit5: BELLANS_TDM
Bit6: V22_TDM
Bit7: V8bisCre_TDM
Bit8: CNG_IP
Bit9: ANS_IP
Bit10: ANSAM_IP
Bit11: ANSBAR_IP
Bit12: ANSAMBAR_IP
Bit13: BELLANS_IP
Bit14: V22_IP
Bit15: V8bisCre_IP
Bit16: V21flag_TDM
Bit17: V21flag_IP
Bit18: V21DIS_TDM
Bit19: V21DIS_IP
Bit20: V21DCN_TDM
Bit21: V21DCN_IP
Bit22: V21Channel_2_TDM
Bit23: V21Channel_2_IP
Bit24: V21Channel_1_TDM
Bit25: V21Channel_1_IP
Bit26: V23_TDM
Bit27: V23_IP
Bit28: BELL202ANS_TDM
Bit29: BELL202ANS_IP
Bit30: BELL202CP_TDM
Bit31: BELL202CP_IP
thresholdThe answer tone detecting threshold. Available range: 0 ~ 13
0: 0dB
1: -3dB
2: -6dB
3: -9dB
4: -12dB
5: -15dB
6: -18dB
7: -21dB
8: -24dB
9: -27dB
10:-30dB (Default setting)
11: -33dB
12:-36dB
13:-39dB.
Return values
0Success
int32 rtk_SetPlayTone ( uint32  chid,
uint32  sid,
DSPCODEC_TONE  nTone,
uint32  bFlag,
DSPCODEC_TONEDIRECTION  Path 
)

Play/Stop the assigned tone.

Parameters
chidThe channel number.
sidThe session number. Usually 0 for master session, 1 for slave(conference) session.
nToneThe tone type, please refer to the DSPCODEC_TONE for more detail information.
bFlagThe play flag
0: Stop
1: Play
PathThe tone direction
Please refer to DSPCODEC_TONEDIRECTION.
Return values
0Success
Note
The tone is various in different countries.
Examples:
conference.c, custom_tone.c, fxo.c, phone.c, and rtp.c.
int32 rtk_SetCountry ( voipCfgParam_t *  voip_ptr)

Set the call-progress tone, busy tone detection parametes and SLIC/DAA impedance according to the selected country.

Parameters
voip_ptrThe configuration of VoIP
Return values
0Success
Note
The parameter is depend on the flash layout.
Examples:
custom_tone.c.
int32 rtk_SetCountryTone ( _COUNTRY_  country)

Set the call-progress tone, and busy tone detection parametes according to the selected country.

Parameters
countryThe selected country, please refer to COUNTRY "COUNTRY" setting.
Return values
0Success
int32 rtk_SetDisTonePara ( voipCfgParam_t *  voip_ptr)

Set the disconnect tone detection parameters.

Parameters
voip_ptrThe configuration of VoIP.
Note
The parameter is depend on the flash layout.
Return values
0Success
Examples:
dis_tone.c.
int32 rtk_SetCustomTone ( uint8  custom,
st_ToneCfgParam *  pstToneCfgParam 
)

Set the custom tone.

Parameters
customThe custom index.
pstToneCfgParamThe custom tone configuration.

A structure of the pstToneCfgParam please refer to st_ToneCfgParam.

Note
Set the tone parameters when you are ready to create your own ringtones set.
Return values
0Success
Examples:
custom_tone.c.
int32 rtk_UseCustomTone ( uint8  dial,
uint8  ringback,
uint8  busy,
uint8  waiting 
)

Use the custom tone to set the dial, ringback, busy, and call waiting tone.

Parameters
dialCustomer dial tone
ringbackCustomer ringing tone
busyCustomer busy tone
waitingCustomer call waiting tone
Note
Before perform rtk_UseCustomTone, the customer tone should have been set by rtk_SetCustomTone().
Return values
0Success
int32 rtk_SetUpdateTone ( uint8  update_country,
uint8  update_tone,
st_ToneCfgParam *  pstToneCfgParam 
)

Set the update tone.

Parameters
update_countryThe update country DSPCODEC_COUNTRY.
update_toneThe update tone DSPCODEC_TONE.
pstToneCfgParamThe update tone configuration.

A structure of the pstToneCfgParam please refer to st_ToneCfgParam.

Note
Set the tone parameters when you are ready to create your own tones set.
Return values
0Success
Examples:
custom_tone.c.
int32 rtk_SipInfoPlayTone ( unsigned int  chid,
unsigned int  sid,
DSPCODEC_TONE  tone,
unsigned int  duration 
)

Play tone when receive SIP INFO.

Parameters
chidThe channel number
sidThe session number. Usually 0 for master session, 1 for slave (conference) session.
toneThe tone need to play. This parameter need be configured before use.
durationThe tone duration (Unit: ms)
Return values
0Success
